hypothesis_content.title: Miner Capitulation Reversal Play
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a period of significant miner capitulation (as indicated by a sharp drop in the Puell Multiple below 0.5), BTC price will experience a mean-reversion rally of at least 15% within the next 30 trading days, as selling pressure from distressed miners subsides and the market absorbs the supply shock.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Miner capitulation represents a forced, non-discretionary selling event. Once this supply is absorbed, the natural buyer base can reassert control. Historical data shows sharp rebounds following extreme Puell Multiple lows, especially when the long-term trend remains intact.
entry_conditions: BTC Puell Multiple (30-day MA) crosses above 0.5 after being below it for at least 7 consecutive days.
BTC price is above its 200-day simple moving average (confirms long-term uptrend structure).

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Close below the local low established during the Puell Multiple dip period.
exit_conditions.time_exit: 30 trading days after entry if neither TP nor SL is hit.

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Price fails to rally 15% within 30 days and instead breaks below the capitulation lows, indicating the selling pressure was not solely miner-driven but part of a broader structural decline.
